Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of rosette and lotus chain in added white outline with added red centre, above two faded white bands; exterior: around rim (now lost), dot and billet pattern between dilute lines; below, pendant triangle and elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggests that it belongs to a heavy chalice.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 263, no. 550)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1544) (phase 2)
